website_summaries.verdict: This unit performs well but some owners think it's overpriced for the overall quality and performance.
pros: An appealing option among customers seeking flexible installation without the cumbersome plugs its competitors require

customer_reviews.title: Could have cost my house with fire!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time im writing a review on Amazon ...i bought this NewAir G73 heater the first one heating element was not working...so i ordered another one and this one almost burnt my garage down coz it did electrical short out and remember this is a 240volt ... it is because of manufacturers fault...the screw for the cover at the back was touching the wires that goes to the thermostat switch...you can see that in the picture...i called the manufacturer and they were not of anyhelp... garbage.... please do yourself a favour and buy anyother heater out there but not this one...it could have cost me my house by burning it down...coz its a 240volt heater....
customer_reviews.author: mohammed hussain

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to have this installed as my contractor got sick in the coldest part of this winter. I have a 750 sq ft garage . This heater took the chill off in about 30 minutes when the temp outside was about 10 degrees. It heated the room up in 15 minutes when it was 40. Thankful to have found this product. It is a bit noisy but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: kms

customer_reviews.title: Double check the cover screw on the back Make sure it doesn’t touch any hot wires
customer_reviews.text: All around a fair heater for the money took the chill off a two car garage in about 20 minutes, the one thing that got me was how it passed any kind of Quality control? when you make up the wires in side the heater and put a cover back on, the cover screw is a dead short! Notice in the picture I added, I realized this after reading a few on reviews on here And sure enough mine was one! But thank goodness I did or possibly could’ve been a fire or electrocution! Anyways three stars for me because of that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a model train layout in my upper garage ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a model train layout in my upper garage. This heater is minimal wattage for the area being heated. However, it is only turned on, when I am in the upper garage. It does a decent job, especially for the price paid. It does get over 70 degrees after a few hours. I do not know, when it gets down to zero, how well it will heat. That will be determined later, not in the near future, I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: I wired this heater up in a two car garage to be able to do some woodworking in the colder months last winter. If you have some basic electrical knowledge, this is easy to install. I ran a new, dedicated line from my fuse box. It works much better than I thought! My garage is not well insulated but I was able to work out there all day with this thing running. I had to preheat the garage for about an hour or so depending on how cold it already was.
customer_reviews.author: Taurus

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Upon installing this heater, exactly like other complaints, the fan does not work. So I get in contact with amazon about it, who refers me to Newair who referred me back to amazon who referred me back to newair who said they could not replace the unit because they didn’t have any then referred me back to amazon who said they couldn’t do anything, but they did have them in stock then referred me back to newair. So after multiple emails, & about an hour over the phone, I’ll be receiving a return label.
customer_reviews.author: jacob simpler

customer_reviews.title: Your house could burn down
customer_reviews.text: Bought this didn't need it installed right away so now i cant return. The fan didnt turn on it heated up then caught fire. This was sent back before thats why i got a deal noticed it was used before. Probably returned cause fan didnt work but they didnt check just sold it again.DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: bryson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't operate like we would have liked
customer_reviews.text: The heater does not have a shut-off. So at the minimum the heater stays on at 1. Which in the midwest fires are a problem so anything you have to leave on like that is a hazard unless you shut off the breaker or create your own shut off switch. The heat took the chill off but unless you run it on high the whole time you won't feel warm at all. I have no idea what it cost us on our electric just to run it the few days we had it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle R

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious!
customer_reviews.text: Bought November 13, 2018, installed easily December 2018 and worked well. November 17, 2019 update the unit will not shut off. Walked into the shop and temp was 89 degrees on medium setting, would not shut off by adjusting the control. Had to shut off at the breaker. Would like a credit if NewAir is willing provide one but I’m not expecting anything. I will send it back to the factory if they want to investigate the issue. Uninstalling today and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost heater
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying a warm garage this season. My garage is about 550 sq. ft. 2 car detached. It gets too cold to enjoy working out there whether on my car or on my machines. This heater makes it comfortable to work without a jacket. I usually turn it on about 30 minutes before starting to work. The heater takes the temp. from the low 40's to about 70 degrees in about an hour and holds it there with the thermostat control knob set at 3, which is about half scale. I do live in a mild climate so others may have a different opinion. Bottom line "it works for me"
customer_reviews.author: Pmotion

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat it for the price. Does what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I have an insulated attached garage with a nice insulated door. This thing will keep it toasty warm. It will take my insulated garage from 48 to 68 in about 40 minutes then run on and off to maintain. I ceiling hung mine s the temp sensor picks up the temp above the working area. I set min 5 degrees higher then desired. Once it has cycled a few times I typically turn it off till it feels chilly. It is not the quietest, but definitely not overwhelmingly loud.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Livesey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Well it was fine for 3 years but it suddenly stopped working. Steady red light and does not heat. My real complaint is horrible customer service by the company when I called. Said I need to by a new one, no trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good little heater
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our small public laundromat wall heater and it works great. Heats well and the only draw back is that the fan is a little loud for me. Otherwise it's work good!
customer_reviews.author: V. R.

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: By the size of it, you'd think it was a toy. I was wrong. It heated a #2 car, non-insulated and drafty, garage with high ceilings in 0 degree weather. My goal was to keep the plumbing in the garage thawed and it accomplished this and more. Easy install too.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Longmire

customer_reviews.title: Great heater just a little noisy.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the amount of noise when it's on. It makes it difficult to watch tv in my garage mancave. Two people talking isn't too bad but you would have to turn the tv up quite a bit when the heater is on. All that said I can use my garage in the winter and be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Moran

customer_reviews.title: Works great, only improvement would be a more precise thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to heat an unheated 3 car garage and this small unit was powerful enough to raise the temp ~30 degrees. I did not notice an inordinate increase in my electric bill either (though I'm sure it had an impact as there were times when it was running 8+ hours a day). The few changes I'd like to see would be a thermostat with actual temperatures (it has a dial that really does not tell you anything) and I'd like to see the thermostat that could be positioned a short distance from the heater. Overall, I recommend this unit. It's fast, powerful, and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: This is a heck of a heater!
customer_reviews.text: This is a heck of a heater! My shop is one large bay and this heater heats it very well! The hardest part was having it wired for the 220v. I put it on a 20amp breaker and never kicks it off. Mounted very easily and its got a quality weight to it. The front vents are adjustable so you can somewhat adjust the airflow direction. Definitely a good decision to buy. Just remember, it's not a plug and play, you have to run 220 to it. But in my search, any heater that will actually do the job you want will be 220v.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Shores

customer_reviews.title: warm basement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and 2 insulated garage doors and now have a warm basement. Spend the extra money and get this good quality, easy to install heater with a great thermostat. Set it on 60 and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Happyashell

customer_reviews.title: It does what they say it will.
customer_reviews.text: I have a one car garage in the Northwest—wet and humid. I have had it running for about 3 weeks and it is maintaining a steady heat of 61—right where I want it, and it cuts itself off on a regular basis. Two caveats—one, if you get it, have an electrician install it, and I'm checking my electric bills; will add to info later.
customer_reviews.author: Penman

customer_reviews.title: NEWAIR TOOK CARE OF ME
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 13 months, company did send me new thermostat under warranty, did not fix it. Newair will not cover a new one, just out of warranty. Then they changed their mind, and now it will be covered under warranty. Thumbs up for NewAir.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent little heater
customer_reviews.text: Unit was easy to put up and wire. When turned on it immediately starts to put out heat. With this being said the units fan isn’t big enough to distribute the heat around the garage. I use my oil furnace to heat up garage and this heater to maintain in this instance it does pretty good. It does save on oil and haven’t seen much of an increase in power bill.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, lots of heat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 26 x 34 shop with 13' ceilings. As of now I have the walls insulated but have not insulated the ceiling (next step). I have it set at "1" and it keeps it right at 45 degrees which was my goal (Average winter temps are in the 20's and 30's. It works well and doesn't have to work hard to keep it at that temperature. I figure once I get the attic insulated this thing will barely turn on. I ran the 10-2 wire and added an outlet on the wall so this unit can plug in via a "dryer" cord. I am giving some serious thought to purchasing another for a separate outbuilding
customer_reviews.author: Kosmo

customer_reviews.title: Heat output
customer_reviews.text: I have installed this heater in a two car garage, and thought there would be more heat output
customer_reviews.author: Dan L

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to modify so fan will turn
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove A silver rod next to the fan in order for it to turn. I heard other people had this problem as well but I took a chance. After doing that and functions as described.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Martin

customer_reviews.title: very weak unit and do not heat up place at all
customer_reviews.text: i bought this unit for my 600 square feet retail store and it suppose to give some heat which i m not expecting 100 percent out of it i have the unit running all day and it does not heat up the place at all you have to be next to unit to feel the heat it not powerfull at all with that value of money you can get much better brand and you can get some heat out of them .
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: NewAir G73 Electric Garage Heater
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this unit because it was rated high by Amazon customers. The unit is very easy to install once you have the 2 pole 240 V 30 AMP circuit ready. The connection is straight forward. It really heats my 3 car garage in time granted that my garage is not fully insulated. This is the unit that I would recommend to anyone looking for an affordable solution to heat a 3 car garage.
customer_reviews.author: HotRod_IL

customer_reviews.title: easy to install work good
customer_reviews.text: love easy_install hate the thermostat is in the back of the heater
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Wrong info
customer_reviews.text: The heater is advertised to heat 750 sq. ft. and on the box it reads only 500 sq.ft. I really needed one a little bigger and this was misleading. I complained but it was ignored.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive for a little heater!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to heat a 25'x15' garage. Pretty much just added breaker and ran the wire straight into the unit. I haven't had a chance to install any insulation in any of the walls, doors, or ceiling yet and this guy still manages to get heat up the whole place. I imagine it wouldn't have to work too hard if I got all the insulation added, which I will do soon. Wouldn't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JEREMY

customer_reviews.title: Loud but effective
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Have to keep it close to high to maintain temp in room. The fan is certainly not quiet but does what i need it to do. Had it wired up with wall switch so i dont have to adjust thermostat on back of unit.
customer_reviews.author: william a revels

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: Really great little heater. Have a 480 sq ft garage that it has kept comfortable and warm so far down to 20 degrees here and not even set at the highest output. Temp control is basic and not easy to reach once hung but does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Kanter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Came in a destroyed box. Electrician that hooked it up can't get it to work. I waited to have a electrician for the 220 but it was past 30 days by the time I got him out. Make sure you are able to get it wired within the 30 days to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product description
customer_reviews.text: Poor product description, incorectly listed by amazon ad as heats 750 sq. feet... when it arrived, right on the box it says good for only 500 . once again they cant get it right...
customer_reviews.author: joel hockin

customer_reviews.title: This will heat up your garage fast!
customer_reviews.text: installed this in my garage to keep my dogs cozy in the winter. What did I ever do without this??? The electrician that installed it said that it looks like the same heating coil in an electric dryer. if you mount it to ceiling you will need a proper 30 amp outlet installed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: booklet/users manual is worthless,
customer_reviews.text: booklet/users manual is worthless, heater works OK but will not heat a standard 2 car garage but will heat a 1 car
customer_reviews.author: John Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Heater didn't even last a month!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy from this company! Heater didn't even last a month! Buy locally if you can, Amazon's policy is that you must return the heater first, then get a replacement or refund. We are stuck now without heat in our garage, and we have products stored there that cannot freeze. We are in a bind now because this product just stopped working!
customer_reviews.author: Donna C. Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have a 600 SF insulated garage. This works perfectly for it and heats it up to a comfortable temp in about 20 minutes from 40 or so degrees. Installation was easy, plenty of YT videos for it if you need.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit at great price
customer_reviews.text: Great unit at great price. Installed in my 2 car garage in northern Michigan. Had no problem keeping the garage at 60 degrees. Wired with a separate 220v thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Love this little heater
customer_reviews.text: Love this little heater. I had to wire it to my 220 but that was pretty easy. It puts out the heat and handles my 600sq foot garage with ease. Granted its not 75 degrees, but its a comfortable 63 degrees all winter in Kansas.
customer_reviews.author: P the C

customer_reviews.title: Love this heater
customer_reviews.text: This heats my garage that's 22'x14' from 18 degrees in no time was up to 68 degrees. I have recommended this to everyone looking for a heater.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Evans

customer_reviews.title: Fan does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Heater works but the fan does not. Paid an electrician to install and I'll have to get another one. Definitely won't be the same brand!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Brovelli

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know what you're buying
customer_reviews.text: What does product a while ago used it for quite a few years heat control valve broke with wired it Direct heat a small area
customer_reviews.author: mike L

customer_reviews.title: A great buy. You will not regret this heater
customer_reviews.text: Best decision i made was to install this in pur garage. Not more freezing garage during winter months.
customer_reviews.author: gary accettulla

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Shabby
customer_reviews.text: I need a heater to get my garage up to a decent temp. This little fan doesn't seem to draw much power and has kept my insulated 2-car garage up to 65 degrees pretty easily. It's a little loud though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat, Thermostat did not work
customer_reviews.text: Heats very well for my 20 x 23 garage. The thermostat does not work at all. Can use as an on/off switch but that was about it. emailed the company to ask about this and did not receive much help. Figure on adding a wall thermostat. That is what I had to do....
customer_reviews.author: JSBergner

customer_reviews.title: very good compact unit
customer_reviews.text: Installation of this heater was very easy. I did have to buy a plug and connector for 30amp service. I wired a number 10 pigtail to the unit so that I could disconnect the unit without going to the service panel. That is working just fine. I would recommend this unit for anyone needing to heat 625 sq.ft. area (garage or workshop).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NewAir G73 Electric Garage Heater
customer_reviews.text: The fan was pushed up against the housing. So removed the grill and bent the fan support brackets so that it cleared. The light does not work. I haven't seen my electric bill yet. It does heat my two car garage nicely.
customer_reviews.author: golden

customer_reviews.title: Good well built heater
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact heater.. worked flawlessly. Perfect for small shed .
customer_reviews.author: john messar

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because it had good reviews. I sent the first one back because it had to be turned up almost all the way just to get it to turn on. The replacement is just has bad, it heats ok but you have no control with the switch. They should probably look at there issues with the thermostat, if they did it would probably be a decent heater.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Phased in, phased out...
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought one of these three years ago, from Amazon. When I got around to installing it it didn't work. I ordered another one, this is what prompted the review. I hooked it up and it didn't work, at that point I figured I must have screwed up. So I opened up my breaker box and could see the error. I installed the 220 volt paired breakers one notch off failing to catch both phases. In my box the phases change every two breakers rather than every other as I was thinking. Moving the breakers one notch cured the problem. This puts out some heat.
customer_reviews.author: JimNecci

customer_reviews.title: Very tiny
customer_reviews.text: Tiny little heater. A lot smaller than you'd expect. It's not ineffective, but there's no way it heats up to 750 sq ft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY WELL MADE
customer_reviews.text: I PUT 2 OF THESE IN A NEW 30X40 GARAGE AND THEY WILL RUN YOU OUT, WELL MADE VERY HOT AIR.I LOVE THEM.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY RABEY

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: 100.00 more than stores, not size i thoughr i was getting
customer_reviews.author: Larry Meese

customer_reviews.title: More Info
customer_reviews.text: The heater came as described but wish more information on the wiring diagram was included. I got the info but would have been handy to have it included with the owner's manual
customer_reviews.author: SRP846

customer_reviews.title: follow up review
customer_reviews.text: It's still fall (WNC mountains) so I haven't been able to really put it to the test but I can say that the product arrived well packaged and in excellent condition. Installation went smoothly. FOLLOW UP. 2 car+ uninsullated garage can hold a compfortable 60 - 65 degrees without turning it up high. Can't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the size fool you. It packs a punch. I have a 24x24 shop. It heats it up fairly quick. Today it was 18 degrees out, in an hour it was 60 deg. I originally wanted something to supplement my wood stove and knock the chill out, but this goes beyond. I have been using this for primary heat and haven't been using my wood stove. Easy hookup, 30amp double pole, 10/2 wire.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sangston

customer_reviews.title: Heats my garage perfectly. Now I can use my ...
customer_reviews.text: Heats my garage perfectly. Now I can use my pool table and just may keep me out of the damn casinos!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby and Pam

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: useless item that went in the rubbish,high power heater no heat
customer_reviews.author: Nas R.

customer_reviews.title: Not too crazy about it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't heat up my small garage.. looking into somthing else
customer_reviews.author: daymi

customer_reviews.title: The NewAir G73 is an excellent garage heater
customer_reviews.text: The NewAir G73 is an excellent garage heater. My garage is 500 sq.ft. 2 car garage. The New Air does a great job heating the space. I highly recommend the G73 to anyone with a 2 car garage of 500 sq. Ft. or less.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T Criger

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. Heat level “volume” control- not a thermostat. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: turned on the power and found that all the fan blades were hitting the heating element had to remove and attempt to repair it is
customer_reviews.text: Installed heater, turned on the power and found that all the fan blades were hitting the heating element had to remove and attempt to repair it is now running fine. While shopping at Menards last week I found they have similar units for much less money. Sorry I purchased it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have two of these in my non insulated garage and ...
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these in my non insulated garage and they keep it VERY warm through the cold winter months.
customer_reviews.author: kmfishs

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad heater
customer_reviews.text: The heater does a good job. The only reason I rated it 3 stars is because there was no wiring diagram of any kind with the unit. It would leave the normal person gussing how to hook it up.
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Works well; warms up a 400 square foot garage. Haven't yet seen the electric bill but the heater is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jamz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: dayton g73 electric garage heater
customer_reviews.text: Have had this item in use for a month, and here in illinios its been miserable. Works great and the difference in my electric bill is nowhere near what i anticipated....Would reccomend this heater to any one..... Don Turner
customer_reviews.author: Donald M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great since purchasing six months ago. I have a 700 SF garage......keeps the temp high enough to work on "shop" projects......If you have a larger garage or space you will need a larger unit.....Otherwise, this product has worked great so far............NOTE: one of the coldest winters in northwest Ohio in years!
customer_reviews.author: steve green

customer_reviews.title: Third time's the charm
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I received had a defective connection to the thermostatic switch that caused it to fail in about 10 days. The second unit arrived with a deformed fan mounting bracket that prevented the fan blades from moving at all. My electrician took the switch from the second unit and wired it into the first unit, creating a Frankenstein heater that is currently working well. The costs of the electrician doubled the total outlay to get a working unit. Verdict: poor quality control. The only really positive part of the experience was that the vendor, RedeemAir, was extremely responsive -- I actually had the second unit in hand within 36 hours of reporting the initial problem. Kudos to RedeemAir.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence B. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. I have a double car garage shop and it kept it warm.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wright

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did not work well in my 360 sq. foot garage, with new insulated door
customer_reviews.author: vincent zappier

customer_reviews.title: it is a nice piece but nearly for sq footage as I seen ...
customer_reviews.text: it is a nice piece but nearly for sq footage as I seen it said in the reviews. I have 298sq ft and no good. I put it in a 12'X12' shed to heat for a air compressor and it does just fine. I would recommend it but be careful of the area you want to heat.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Compact and great heater
customer_reviews.text: I have an electrician installed the heater for me. Unit is very compact. I have 2 garage and it is able to heat up to the 60s and outside it's in the teens. Don't know about the electric bill yet. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: pc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Provides ample heat for my 300 sqft garage. First unit was defective.
customer_reviews.author: David Haltenhof

customer_reviews.title: Big Bank for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1200 sq. ft. garage and believe it or not, this little heater brought the temperature from 32 degrees to 64 degrees overnight and it has remained at that temperature throughout the space. Big bang for your buck for sure. We had a professional electrician install because we needed a new breaker (cost us $375.00) but my son-in-law bought one after he saw how great it works and he was able to install his new breaker himself for less than $100.00
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Small unit with a big punch. I've got a four car garage. At 40 degrees it makes it comfortable to work.
customer_reviews.author: richard d.tomon

customer_reviews.title: dayton garage heater
customer_reviews.text: unit works great. It's smaller than I thought it would be which was an added plus. I had to hire an electrician to do the job, but that wasn't a problem either. I'm very satisfied with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, is keeping my 24x24 garage at 45-50 degrees while outside temps are in the teens.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest H Nye

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchaced as backup heater to keep garage from freezing when not in there. I keep it around 50 degrees and does an excellent job. Garage is 14x30 and mostly insulated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Have in a standard size garage and works well. Takes longer the colder it is outside but that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amy stoltz

customer_reviews.title: NewAir Electric Heater
customer_reviews.text: Keeps our enclosed deck at a constant 70 degrees which is nice. Suggestion, if you have a TV on your deck make sure you mount the heater away from it. Not loud but when the blower comes on you can hear it.
customer_reviews.author: John Cahill

customer_reviews.title: heater body gets too warm for thermostat
customer_reviews.text: seems like a descent heater but the fan output sucks! The heater body gets hot and trips the thermostat off and the small garage is not too warm.
customer_reviews.author: Lantz E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: One of the blades hits the frame makes a loud noise when it starts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been a very good heater for our 2 car garage in the Mid ...
customer_reviews.text: Been a very good heater for our 2 car garage in the Mid Atlantic region. In the coldest part of winter it can keep our garage right about the mid-60's, which is perfectly fine for our garage. If we lived somewhere that was colder or had a larger garage, we would probably need 2 or a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: ObjectiveAdvice

customer_reviews.title: Puts out the heat
customer_reviews.text: I installed this heater in my garage to be more comfortable when I work out there in the winter. It only takes a few minutes to take the chill out of my three-car garage. In fact, I often have to turn it off while I'm out there because I get too warm. Be aware, this little heater draws 50 amps at 220 volts. You will need to install a separate circuit breaker.
customer_reviews.author: BTatum

customer_reviews.title: NewAir G73 Electric Garage Heater
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is...good for only 500 sq. ft. of space. It feels great if you stand in front of it, say at your workbench wrenching away. I believe it would be ideal for keeping the temperature high enough to keep something from freezing inside a 500-600 sq. ft. space. The downside for me was that the thermostat burned up at about the 11th month of ownership (after only 5 months of on and off usage). Grainger gave me a new one at no cost and I sold it at a loss to myself without having opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gale McCormick

customer_reviews.title: smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.text: just not as powerful as i expected. but seems fine. i'll have to add more insulation in the polebarn. not a substitute for my bullet propane heater.
customer_reviews.author: jigmoore

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have a small 12 x 24 shop and this heater is great for it. I live in the Midwest and this heater is working great for I maintain 45 degrees in there all the time using very little electric. Now my shed is very well insulated and I know that has a lot to do with it, when I go out there to work I can get it to 70 in very little time. It was packaged well. I did change 1 thing on it I moved the thermostat bulb outside the unit for better sensing of room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Anderson

customer_reviews.title: electric garage heater
customer_reviews.text: Works well, worth the money so far. Happy with the purchase. Installation was not bad, 220 volt makes for quick heating.
customer_reviews.author: david jamison

customer_reviews.title: Better wire diagram for installation
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat needs to be remote from heater. Better wire diagram for installation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little heater, takes the chill off in my 2 car garage.
customer_reviews.author: George Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Did what I needed though in the long term gas may have been cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Been good for a couple years now... really adds draw on the electrical bill but it does warm our two car garage nicely on the coldest of days. For the love of your wallet- don't leave your garage door open!
customer_reviews.author: Eno

customer_reviews.title: Got it all hooked up and it worked great for a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to heat a 20' x 20' insulated garage. Got it all hooked up and it worked great for a year. Then it started just blowing air. I disconnected it and inspected the inside for any problems. I found the wires had burned up the factory connections, and was not worth repairing. This was a piece of junk and just a waste of money. Look for something by a good, reputable manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: LenNJ

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: Great quiet heater. It's heating my big old beater of a garage with 10ft heat sucking ceilings. 32 degrees outside and the heater took it up to 60 in an hour.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: This unit heats two car garage from 50 degrees to 70 degrees in less than a hour haven't recieved electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Dzia.

customer_reviews.title: It's in the garbage after two months
customer_reviews.text: This heater was powerful enough to keep a partially insulated two car garage at 65 F during the Vermont winter. For two months. The electric connections of the heating resistance burned and the machine only blew clod air. The 240 V installation was properly done by a professional company. It's now on the trash. And it increased our electricity bill in $150 every month.
customer_reviews.author: sergiomanchego

customer_reviews.title: not for a 400 sqft garage, go bigger.
customer_reviews.text: A little small and not an impressive amount of heat but it looks good hanging there and does well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kewanee Joe

customer_reviews.title: Garage heater
customer_reviews.text: Product was as discribed and I am satisfied with my purchase and with the sellers service.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bodreau

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this September 2014. Today April 15th, 2016 I turned it on, heard it fizzle and then it shut off. It's dead now. Checked my voltages. All good. I did not use it much in the year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Heater works OK, but too small to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: Although rated at 17,000 BTUs, I am a little disappointed at the amount of heat it produces in my 540 sq. ft. shop. I was hoping it would heat my shop, but it's too small to do the job. It DOES make my electric meter spin! Have not yet seen an electric bill. O well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Swartley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, with deceptive description
customer_reviews.text: Sent a used product, fan making clunky noises. No wiring diagram to make install easy. Limited support. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: chad pierce

product_meta.title: NewAir G73 Hardwired Electric Garage Heater, Heats up to 500 square feet
product_meta.description:
Color:White

Enjoy a warmer more comfortable space as you work in your workshop or garage with the NewAir G73 electric garage heater! Featuring 17,060 BTUs of heating capacity, this garage heater can warm up to 500 sq. ft. Because the NewAir G73 runs on electricity instead of propane, it's safer and more convenient than gas heaters. Mount it on the wall or ceiling and direct the heat where you need it with the included swivel bracket. Built of sturdy steel with a powder-coated finish, this powerful, rugged heater is exactly what you need to keep your workshop warm this winter.
feature_bullets: [Rugged Exterior, Built to Last] The NewAir G73 hard-shell exterior is made from heavy-duty stainless steel. Not only is it durable, but it’s built to last, especially in tough climates and work conditions. It also comes with a mounting bracket for you to place it on the wall or ceiling of your workspace. This way you can stay toasty and safe with a heater hidden from busy work areas.

[A Powerful Fan to Keep You Warm While You Work] Get quick heat from a fan powerful enough to spread warm air evenly throughout a 500 square foot radius. If you have a two-car garage, large workspace or shed, you’ll remain warm while you do your work, especially in the dead of winter.

[Hardwired to Your 30 Amp Breaker] The NewAir G73 doesn’t come with any of the maintenance issues of a propane heater. It needs to be hardwired into your breaker, so consider hiring a professional electrician to help you. Once your heater is hardwired, your warm workspace is only a switch away.

[An ETL Certified Heater You Can Trust] This Heater is considered one of the safest on the market and is our customers tried-and-true favorite. It is ETL certified for electrical safety, and comes with overheating protection, so rest assured you have one of the most trusted heaters available.

[Direct Your Heat Anywhere with Adjustable Louvers] Direct heat anywhere in your garage with the adjustable louvers and easy tilt head. If you happen to be sitting in one location while you work, you can make sure the heat is sent to the exact spot you need. Or, you can turn the louvers completely open to allow heat to travel everywhere. The choice is yours.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars405 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: All product are backed by a 1 year warranty against manufacturer defects. Warranty voids if purchased from any other seller that is not amazon retail or air & water inc.
